attributes.action: Prevent 2nd EU Referendum as Gov Election also had low turnout not contested
attributes.additional_details: Conservatives in the 2015 general election came to power with only 36.9% of the votes and only a 66.1% UK turnout and this was never contested and this was well below the 75% turnout
attributes.background: EU referendum was fair and everyone had to register for the vote so it should not be contested! The referendum turnout was 71.8%, with more than 30 million people voting. It was the highest turnout in a UK-wide vote since the 1992 general election.
